botanical_details.genus: Lilium are bulbous perennials with erect stems bearing whorled or spirally arranged leaves and terminal racemes or umbels of bowl-shaped, trumpet-shaped, funnel-shaped or turks cap shaped flowers, often fragrant, and white, yellow, orange or red

how_to_grow.cultivation: Grow in well-drained soil enriched with leaf mould or well-rotted organic matter. Ideally grow in full sun with the base of the plant in shade.
how_to_grow.propagation: Propagate by division or scaling, see bulb propagation for details. It is also possible to propagate by seed, though plants produced from seed will vary.
how_to_grow.pruning: Deadhead after flowering. Cut back stems when foliage dies down.
how_to_grow.pests: May be susceptible to lily beetle, aphids, slugs, thrips, leatherjackets and wireworms, as well as small mammals such as rabbits and voles
how_to_grow.diseases: May be susceptible to grey moulds, various fungal infections and virus diseases
